intro: Warrea candida, commonly known as the white warrea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Warrea candida is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
